businessSummary.oneLiner: AI-powered data analytics platform for government and enterprise ‚Äî transforming from a core U.S. defense and intelligence software partner into a commercial AI powerhouse.
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since the launch of AIP (AI Platform), the commercial segment has been growing explosively. Q4 2025 revenue reached $1.407B (+70% YoY), with U.S. commercial revenue hitting $507M (+137% YoY). Recent developments include a DHS $1B 5-year BPA (Blanket Purchase Agreement), an expanded AI infrastructure partnership with Rackspace, and a Mizuho upgrade to Buy ‚Äî but the stock is down 24% in 2026. The Percepta AI lawsuit saw a non-compete injunction denied, while DISA IL5/IL6 authorization was achieved, painting a mixed picture.
howTheyMakeMoney: U.S. Government: Data analytics platforms for DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS, and others ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
U.S. Commercial: Enterprise AI and data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), the fastest-growing segment
International Government: Contracts with NATO allies and other foreign governments
International Commercial: Global enterprise clients (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription-based SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî Enterprise AI integration platform, the core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî Data analysis and decision-making platform for government and defense
Foundry ‚Äî Enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî Software deployment automation and management infrastructure
TITAN ‚Äî U.S. Army next-generation intelligence system (large-scale contract)

keyMetrics.name: P/E Ratio (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely elevated valuation. Even accounting for 70% growth, PEG of 2.3 places it firmly in overvalued territory.

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on 2026 consensus earnings. Still more than 2x the software sector average, commanding a significant premium.

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: 10 consecutive quarters of acceleration. U.S. commercial +137% YoY. Among the highest growth rates in software industry history.

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Rule of 40 = 127% (70% growth + 57% adjusted margin). Top tier in the software industry.

keyMetrics.name: Free Cash Flow (Annual)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Q4 adjusted FCF $791M (56% margin). Strong cash generation. +82% YoY.

keyMetrics.name: Debt-to-Equity
keyMetrics.interpretation: Cash + short-term Treasuries of $7.2B, zero debt. Current ratio 7.11. A net cash fortress.

keyMetrics.name: 2026 Guidance
keyMetrics.interpretation: Q1 2026 guidance of $1.532-1.536B vs. consensus $1.32B ‚Äî a massive beat. Adjusted FCF guidance $3.93-4.13B.

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-year BPA ‚Äî procurement without competitive bidding
growthDrivers.description: Signed a 5-year, $1B Blanket Purchase Agreement with the Department of Homeland Security. CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA, and other DHS sub-agencies can procure Palantir software without competitive bidding. RPO surged from $2.6B to $4.2B (+$1.6B), reflecting the pipeline.

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace partnership expansion ‚Äî 250+ dedicated engineers
growthDrivers.description: Strategic partnership with Rackspace to accelerate AI deployment. Running Foundry and AIP on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign data centers. Dedicated Palantir engineering team scaling from 30 to 250+ by early 2027.

growthDrivers.title: U.S. commercial revenue +137% ‚Äî explosive growth with record deal value
growthDrivers.description: Q4 U.S. commercial revenue of $507M (+137% YoY). AIP-driven enterprise AI adoption is accelerating. Top 20 customers averaging $94M/year (+45% YoY). U.S. commercial deal value backlog up +145% YoY to $4.38B.

growthDrivers.title: DISA IL5/IL6 authorization + Airbus Skywise renewal + Navy $440M
growthDrivers.description: PFCS Forward IL5/IL6 authorization expands defense edge deployments. Airbus extended its multi-year Skywise data platform deal (50,000+ daily users). Large contracts secured consecutively. Pipeline is at an all-time high across both government and commercial segments.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Undisputed #1 in government and defense AI, with AIP rapidly building a strong commercial AI position. Irreplaceable in data security plus AI integration.

moats.description: Holds top-tier security authorizations from CIA, NSA, DHS, and others. DHS BPA enables procurement without competitive bidding. DISA IL5/IL6 authorized. It would take competitors years to achieve equivalent clearance levels.
More customers improve the AI models, and better models attract more customers ‚Äî creating a virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. The Airbus multi-year contract renewal and DHS 5-year BPA demonstrate the stickiness.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Data cloud platform expanding AI capabilities, but weak in the government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private company, data lakehouse. Competes in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly lags in growth rate and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by former Palantir employees. Non-compete injunction denied, free to compete.

recentNews.headline: Mizuho upgrades PLTR from Neutral to Outperform ($195) ‚Äî 'growth + margin profile is one of a kind'
recentNews.significance: Mizuho analyst Gregg Moskowitz states 'the recent selloff is unjustifiable; AIP is a category of one,' upgrading to Outperform. Stock traded $131.17 to $136.35 intraday on the news, reflecting persistent selling pressure despite the upgrade.

recentNews.headline: Percepta AI lawsuit ‚Äî non-compete injunction denied, only employee solicitation ban granted
recentNews.significance: Federal judge denied the request to bar three former key employees from working at Percepta AI. Only a ban on soliciting Palantir employees was granted. The competitor is now free to operate, materializing the talent-poaching risk.

recentNews.headline: DHS awards $1B 5-year BPA ‚Äî AI platform procurement without competitive bidding
recentNews.significance: CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA, and other DHS sub-agencies can directly procure Palantir software. A single government contract adds $1B+ to backlog, streamlining future federal procurement.

recentNews.headline: Rackspace strategic partnership ‚Äî accelerating Foundry and AIP enterprise deployment
recentNews.significance: Deploying Foundry and AIP on Rackspace infrastructure, scaling dedicated engineers to 250+. A key partnership for expanding commercial AI distribution channels.

recentNews.headline: DISA PFCS Forward IL5/IL6 authorization secured + Airbus Skywise multi-year contract extended
recentNews.significance: Critical authorization for on-premises and edge defense deployments. Airbus renewed its data platform agreement covering 50,000+ daily users. Reinforces both government and commercial pipeline simultaneously.

recentNews.headline: Daiwa upgrades to Buy at $180 ‚Äî Burry posts head-and-shoulders chart, sparking selloff
recentNews.significance: Daiwa cited AI demand and commercial momentum for its Buy upgrade to $180. The same day, Michael Burry posted a head-and-shoulders chart on social media, fueling selling. Bull and bear narratives clashed directly.

analystOpinions.notableComment: 20-analyst coverage: 5 Strong Buy + 4 Buy = 9 total Buy, 10 Hold, 1 Sell. Average target $187.95 (+39%), median $198. Mizuho upgraded to Outperform $195 (2/18), Daiwa Buy $180 (2/10), Citi Strong Buy $260 (street high), BofA Buy $255. Burry warns of a decline to $50. At $135.24, the stock sits 35% off its ATH.

risks.title: Extreme valuation ‚Äî P/E 215x, down 24% in 2026
risks.description: P/E of 215x, PEG of 2.3 signals overvaluation. Amid the SaaS-pocalypse, further downside is possible. Burry has identified a head-and-shoulders pattern suggesting a decline to $50-60. Both 50-day ($155) and 200-day ($171) moving averages are above current price, confirming a downtrend.

risks.title: Percepta AI talent drain + non-compete injunction denied
risks.description: Three former key employees founded Percepta AI. Federal judge denied the non-compete injunction, allowing the competitor to operate freely. Only an employee solicitation ban was granted. Risk to the structural moat is now real.

risks.title: Burry's 'wicked accounting' criticism ‚Äî AR surge, CEO compensation controversy
risks.description: Accounts receivable grew faster than revenue in 9 of 12 quarters. CEO Karp's $17M jet costs (+123% YoY). Share count diluting +4.67% YoY.

risks.title: SaaS-pocalypse ‚Äî fears that AI could replace traditional SaaS
risks.description: Market fears that AI will render traditional SaaS obsolete are driving broad SaaS selloffs. Stock declining despite DHS, Rackspace, and Mizuho catalysts proves deteriorating sentiment.

risks.title: Government budget dependency and DOGE spending cut risk
risks.description: While the DHS $1B BPA is positive, government spending cut initiatives could have a direct impact. Government revenue remains a large portion of the overall mix, posing concentration risk.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA + Airbus Skywise + Navy $440M ‚Äî pipeline at all-time high
buyReasons.rationale: Major contracts secured consecutively. The DHS BPA creates a no-bid procurement channel, locking in long-term revenue. 2026 guidance of $7.18-7.20B (+60% YoY) and Q1 guidance of $1.532-1.536B (vs. $1.32B consensus) secure strong growth visibility.

buyReasons.title: 35% correction from ATH + debt-free cash fortress of $7.2B
buyReasons.rationale: Cash + short-term Treasuries of $7.2B, zero debt, current ratio of 7.11. Mizuho Outperform $195, Daiwa Buy $180, Citi $260. Consensus $188 implies +39% upside from current levels.

buyReasons.title: Rule of 40 = 127% ‚Äî unprecedented growth and margin combination in software history
buyReasons.rationale: 70% growth + 57% adjusted margin. U.S. commercial +137% YoY, deal value backlog +145% YoY. AIP enterprise adoption is accelerating, and the Rackspace partnership expands deployment channels.

overallOpinion: DHS $1B BPA, Rackspace partnership, and U.S. commercial +137% growth demonstrate real traction. Q1 guidance also crushed the $1.32B consensus at $1.53B.
P/E of 215x is overvalued territory, but the SaaS-pocalypse and Burry attacks have driven a 24% decline in 2026 ‚Äî now 35% off ATH and trading below both the 50-day and 200-day moving averages.
Mizuho Outperform $195, Daiwa Buy $180, Citi Strong Buy $260 ‚Äî 9 of 20 analysts are buyers. Average target $188 implies 39% upside.
Percepta AI non-compete injunction denial materializes talent-drain risk. Watch whether the structural moat holds as the competitive landscape shifts.
Q1 earnings will determine whether this is unfairly caught in the SaaS-pocalypse or a legitimate valuation reset. RSI of 40 approaches oversold territory, offering a potential technical floor.

sources.name: Motley Fool ‚Äî Palantir $1B Deal
sources.description: DHS contract analysis, evidence of AI adoption acceleration

sources.name: Benzinga ‚Äî PLTR Friday
sources.description: 2/21 price action, Percepta non-compete injunction denied

sources.name: Benzinga ‚Äî Burry Moat Criticism
sources.description: Burry: 'Moat is just obstruction of data transfer,' AR surge criticism

sources.name: MarketBeat ‚Äî PLTR Forecast
sources.description: HSBC Buy $205, BofA Buy $255, latest analyst distribution

sources.name: CNBC ‚Äî Palantir Q4 2025 Earnings
sources.description: Q4 earnings report: EPS $0.25 vs. $0.21 expected, revenue $1.41B

sources.name: 247 Wall St. ‚Äî Will PLTR Hit $200
sources.description: 2026 price target analysis, Daiwa Buy $180 upgrade context
